knowledge.title: PHP
knowledge.description: PHP was my first backend language. I learned it because I had to fix several bugs in some projects at work. Later I had to use it in college.

knowledge.title: Magento ®
knowledge.description: I learned how to use plugins, create themes, create block, controllers and observers, add attributes to products and classes. In both, 1.9 and 2.1 versions.

projects.title: Eduntref
projects.description: Update from Magento 1 to Magento 2. Change in styling.

knowledge.title: Javascript
knowledge.description: I learned Javascript working in Phonegap and using it for web game dev. I used jQuery for almost everythin(animations, AJAX, insert items in DOM, etc). Now, I am moving to React.

projects.title: Tablero
projects.description: Board game for Fundación YPF. I have developed the board, trivias and the minigames(except the solar energy one), using jQuery. We were a team of 3. One artist, a producer and I.

projects.title: Stopmotion
projects.description: Stopmotion experiencie for Fundación YPF. It is a tool for making GIFs in a stop-motion style. We were a team of 4. One artist, a producer and 2 programmers. My job was take the code in PHP from the other programmer and make it a single page application.

knowledge.title: Ruby
knowledge.description: I took classes of Ruby in college. We learned Ruby Vanilla, Rails and Sinatra.

knowledge.title: Gatsby
knowledge.description: I wanted to learn React, and I found that Gatsby is based on it. I used Gatsby for this page.

knowledge.title: Unity 3D
knowledge.description: I worked with C# and have experience with 3D gaming, networking, VR and AR(Vuforia)

projects.title: Museo Interactivo
projects.description: It is a game for an interactive classroom in Museo de Ciencias Naturales in La Plata. It has 3 modules, one for administration, one for a TV with multitouch input and one for 45 tablets. The game consists in 6 mini-games. And all is controlled from the admin module.
